definition: to preserve and nurture one's spirit (idiom); honing one's strength for the big push
to raise (animals)/to bring up (children)/to keep (pets)/to support/to give birth
essence/extract/vitality/energy/semen/sperm/mythical goblin spirit/highly perfected/elite/the pick of sth/proficient (refined ability)/extremely (fine)/selected rice (archaic)
to store up/to grow (e.g. a beard)/to entertain (ideas)
acute

sentences.english: Save yourself for the game tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 为明天的比赛而养精蓄锐吧。

sentences.english: Nurturing your spirituality is one of the best ways to sneak time in for yourself every day.
sentences.chinese: 养精蓄锐是每天给自己空余更多时间的最好方法之一。

sentences.english: Save your strength for the hard work you'll have to do later.
sentences.chinese: 养精蓄锐以应付今后你得去从事的繁重工作。

sentences.english: They replenished themselves in a seaside sanatorium for two weeks.
sentences.chinese: 他们在海滨疗养院养精蓄锐休养了两个星期。

to wait at one's ease for the exhausted enemy/to nurture one's strength and bide one's time (idiom)
to rest and reorganize (military)
to set up camp/Taiwan pr. [an1 ying2 zha2 zhai4]
hibernation/living in seclusion
to prepare/to make adequate preparation
to wait for dawn, one's head resting on a spear (idiom)/fully prepared and biding one's time before the battle
to recuperate/to recover/to convalesce
to have a rest/to stay for the night/to go to bed/to sleep
in a spurt of energy
rest/to rest
hard fighting/fierce battle
to wait for action after having accumulated power, energy etc
to conceal one's strengths and bide one's time (idiom)/to hide one's light under a bushel
lit. to reorganize flags and drums (idiom); to regroup after a setback/to prepare for new initiatives/to attempt a comeback
a blitzkrieg strategy (idiom)/to resolve sth in the shortest time possible/to get sth done quickly
